Description: Pottery two-handled cup or shallow bowl in coarse fabric, probably related to Plain White II ware; wheel-made; conical body on a low conical foot; vertical neck with slightly concave sides; pair of opposing loop handles, crudely finished; made of coarse red-orange clay with numerous white inclusions, covered with what appears to be a red slip or wash (worn away in many places); the foot is chipped and surface is abraded.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Horatio Herbert Kitchener, Earl Kitchener of Khartoum
Curator's comments: The number 164 pencilled on the vase may refer to the original excavations, but this is not certain. See D. Bailey, Op. Ath. VI (1965), pp. 5-13 for details of the Hake-Kitchener excavations. Parallels: SCE IV/2, fig. XVII,10 (Marion T.69); J. Webb, Corpus of Cypriot Antiquities 12, no. 20;
Acquisition name: Transferred from: Victoria and Albert Museum
